review_blob:
70+ days in a row of over 100 degree temperature.  Waterloo to the rescue!

Tart, highly carbonated, and low alcohol make this one of the most refreshing beers in Austin.  Seems like they drew a lot of inspiration from Dogfishs Festina Peche - and thats fine by me.
beer_name: Black Star Co-op Pub & Brewery Waterloo

review_blob: I usually prefer Czech Pilsners (Live Oak), but this German Pils is really cool.  Its much hoppier than I was expecting, both in aroma and flavor.  The hops are really bright and spicy, which makes for a pretty refreshing beer considering how much flavor there is.

As their deScription mentions, this is definitely not their standard IPA with some roasted malts thrown in.   And, honestly, I think it would be a better beer if it were.

I still enjoyed this beer, but I thought of it more as a hoppy Porter than a Black IPA.  Plenty of bittering hops, a decent amount of flavor hops, but not much in the aroma department.  

Overall, a nicely made beer, but not what I look for in an a Black IPA

Mighty fine Czech Pils from one of my favorite breweries.

Classically made and it shows.  Clean and refreshing but still rich and full flavored.   Sometimes a little bit corny.
Continuously hopped...  Yeah, its a gimmick.   Its also a really nice beer.   Well balanced and well made.  Never any off flavors.   Not too exciting,  but perfectly solid.

Forgetting the fact that it comes in a can, this is the best IPA in Texas.  And it comes in a can!

Great citrus/floral aroma, almost perfect balance and really clean flavors.  Damn good beer.
